intro: Stenactis strigosa, commonly known as the rough stenactis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a distinctive corolla shape. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
